name: Number of tourist departures per 1000 - World Bank & UN (2019)
title: Number of tourist departures per 1000 - World Bank & UN (2019)
description: Number of tourist departures per 1000 was derived based on the number of departures per year divided by total population figures from the World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI)

sources.name: World Bank, World Development Indicators (2019)
sources.dataPublisherSource: World Tourism Organization, Yearbook of Tourism Statistics, Compendium of Tourism Statistics and data files
sources.additionalInfo: Number of tourist departures per 1000 was derived based on the number of departures per year divided by total population figures from the World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI)

resources.path: Number of tourist departures per 1000 - World Bank & UN (2019).csv

fields.name: Number of departures (per 1000 people)
fields.description: International outbound tourists are the number of departures that people make from their country of usual residence to any other country for any purpose other than a remunerated activity in the country visited. The data on outbound tourists refer to the number of departures, not to the number of people traveling. Thus a person who makes several trips from a country during a given period is counted each time as a new departure. This figure is given per 1000 people.
